comment: For the essays she's overly critical for no reason. First time I've ever gotten a B in an english class and it was an 88, final essay was a 96 and all I needed for an A was a 100. Her feedback was over things I had already fixed at the writing center and fixed from her review of my draft. She was not very helpful at all and I wouldn't take again

Professor Greil is a tough grader, but she gives great feedback. The material wasn't too hard, but it is very easy to fall behind. She is easy to talk to and is very understanding. There is a lot of writing, but it's an English course so it makes sense. Do not use AI for writing anything because she will get ya!!
Her directions are never clear, whenever she reviews something before grading it she says you did so good but then gives you a 70 when your turn it in, annoying.
She was fine.

This was an online class, so there was a discussion post every week from a reading. The readings were very interesting and informative. The discussion posts were an easy A, however, when it comes to the essays, she is a tough grader. There were 4 essays overall.

I took this class online and it was my first online one. She is a pretty straightforward teacher and tells you what assignments you have each week. We do a discussion post every week and respond to one other persons. We write four essays and do four peer reviews. She is a tough grader when it comes to essays.

I took this class online. It didn't take up a lot of time to do the work assigned every week. The reading was a few pages, & the responses did have to be on different days, but it takes less than 30 mins to do. Papers were graded clearly. If you want to make an A, just put in the work , & if you have questions, email her. She's quick and helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She was a pretty good professor. It was an online class, so everything was electronic. If you do the work and follow directions you will do well, I did anyway. Would probably take again if I had a chance to choose.
This was an online class and I didn't know what to expect but was not disappointed. There is a lot of work, but it is reasonable. She is available and answers messages fast. I would do it over again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Online class that should've been taken in class; amount of coursework was unbelievable for an online class. Prepare to have no life. You cannot post/comment on discussion boards on the same day. You have to read 2-3 lengthy essays and submit a discussion post. The peer reviews are the worst. I didn't like having illiterate people reading my papers.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Very picky on grading

Very tough on papers! Online writing was pretty easy if you read material. She was not that helpful in her editing process in telling me how I needed to write better, or how I didn't meet the requirements she wanted. Very tough on grades

Mrs. Greil was a good professor, even with an online class. It was my first time taking a class online and I was not disappointed. It felt like I knew what to do all along, so I just followed her instructions and did fine in the class. She was a good professor.

Professor Greil was passionate about this course. You use the text book often for online discussions. Although she is very nice, she is too vague on what she wants out of her papers. Even after following what her outlines specified, I was still unable to get above a C on any papers. Grades very harshly and doesn't specify deductions. Simply, awful.

Ms. Greil was super sweet and also smart. Major papers make up the majority of your grade plus other things and there is assigned reading. I thought it was a good class and felt I learned what I needed to. You will know what is expected of you, which all you have to do is stay on top of it and pay attention.    I give her an A.

I really liked her, she's a great prof. Class attendance is required, but it's a pretty good class most of the time. Major papers make up the majority of the grade plus assugned reading and other things like that. I thought Dr. Greil was great, smart and and super super sweet.

Prof Greil was very sweet and totally engaged in the conversation. She loves talking about pop culture and allows for a lot of freedowhen it comes to choosing essay topics. If you follow the guidelines you should make an A. HIGHLY SUGGEST TAKING HER.

Professor Greil is a very nice person; however, she takes everything very personal and teaches somewhat like a high school teacher. She doesn't appreciate her students thinking outside the box although she believes she wants critical thinking. I would recommend this class, just make sure you suck up to her and she will love you.

She is very sweet but seems to take everything personally. Assignments are a little vague and she grades hard. Class is extremely boring. I never would have shown up for class if attendance wasn't mandatory. You do use your book.

Teacher is very biased. You will know if she likes you or not by the first class period, if she doesn't i suggest you run. She liked me, but its still impossible to get an A on any paper. She corrections the stupidest things. Attendance is mandatory and classes are beyond boring. You're writing everyday in class on pointless material.

She was inspiring and a very good teacher overall. I don't care very much for English courses, but this one I found interesting, valuable and amusing. Walked out a better writer and with a good grade so you can't argue with that!!
One of the sweetest prof I've met in my life. She would keep telling you how to write an essay. Just don't miss the deadline, otherwise she will keep asking if you will submit your essay.

Really sweet professor.  Will go above and beyond to help you with an assignment.  This class is an easy A if you follow the syllabus and turn in your assignments.  She can rant on a little about certain issues and topics but if you can tune her out for the first 10-15 minutes of class you'll survive the other hour or so.

Professor Greil is awesome in my not humble opinion. She is cool and not too strict but will teach you things too, we had a few big papers but nothing too hard to handle. I would defenitely recommend taking her class to other students.
I loooooooved Ms. Greil's class! It was challenging but not TOO hard and what we did in class was usually pretty interesting. Great teacher!!

Very fair teacher.  I agree that sometimes she gets a little too involved with the assignments, but overall great teacher.  Only 4 major papers and little to no small stuff.  Take her class if you can.

I would recomend her. She goes over assignments very well and is willing to help you on any aspect of writing. The final research paper was done in a step by step process in the class. If you are not so great at writing, take her. You'll do good in her class and she will actually help your writing ability. Plus she's really nice.
Fun class, & shes an interesting teacher. Sometimes goes over assignments too much, but thats good to because it means shes clear. Pretty good class.
Grades fairly, very helpfull, classes are interesting. Just enough homework and not too time consuming. Very nice person that really cares about her students.
Ms. Greil is always available for help/explanation.  Her assignments and grading are fair and she's willing to help.  Great professor, highly recommended!
